meanings.definition: To make someone feel angry or annoyed.
meanings.sent1: The loud noise angered the neighbors.
meanings.sent2: She was angered by his rude comment.
meanings.sent3: The cat's refusal to eat the new food angered its owner.
meanings.sent4: The constant delays in the project angered the boss.
meanings.sent5: His careless actions always seemed to anger his friends.

meanings.sent1: He quickly angered when his sister teased him.
meanings.sent2: The child angered at the unfair treatment.
meanings.sent3: The computer seemed to anger whenever too many tabs were open.
meanings.sent4: Her face angered as she listened to the lies.
meanings.sent5: The storm clouds gathered, and the sky seemed to anger in response.
